import Mathlib.RingTheory.HopfAlgebra
import Mathlib.Topology.CompletelyRegular
import Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Polish

import SBSProofs.Utils
import SBSProofs.RKHS.Basic

open Classical MeasureTheory

local macro_rules | `($x ^ $y) => `(HPow.hPow $x $y)

set_option trace.Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite true
set_option maxHeartbeats 600000

variable {d : â„•} {Î© : Set (Vector â„ d)} [MeasureSpace Î©]

def L2 (Î¼ : Measure Î©) [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] := {f : Î© â†’ â„ | Memâ„’p f 2 Î¼}

def eigen := {v : â„• â†’ â„ // âˆ€ i, 0 <= v i}

def f_repr (v : eigen) (e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„) (f : Î© â†’ â„) (a : â„• â†’ â„) := (f = Î» x â†¦ (âˆ‘' i, (v.1 i) * (a i) * (e i x))) âˆ§ (âˆ€ x, Summable (Î» i â†¦ (v.1 i) * (a i) * (e i x)))

/-
  We define a set of functions that depends on a finite measure Î¼. Each function is representable by a infinite sum.
-/

def H (v : eigen) (e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„) (Î¼ : Measure Î©) [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] := {f | f âˆˆ L2 Î¼ âˆ§ âˆƒ (a : â„• â†’ â„), (f_repr v e f a) âˆ§ Summable (Î» i â†¦ (v.1 i) * (a i)^2)}

def set_repr {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f : H v e Î¼) := {a : â„• â†’ â„ | (f_repr v e f.1 a) âˆ§ (Summable (Î» i â†¦ (v.1 i) * (a i)^2))}

lemma set_repr_ne {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f : H v e Î¼) : (set_repr f).Nonempty :=

/-
  We assume that the the representative of each function in H is unique (property of v and e).
-/

axiom set_repr_unique {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] {f : H v e Î¼} {a b : â„• â†’ â„} (ha : a âˆˆ set_repr f) (hb : b âˆˆ set_repr f) : a = b

lemma unique_choice {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] {f : H v e Î¼} {a : â„• â†’ â„} (h : a âˆˆ set_repr f) : (set_repr_ne f).some = a := set_repr_unique (set_repr_ne f).some_mem h

/-
  We assume that the product of two representative is summable.
-/

axiom product_summable {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f g : H v e Î¼) : Summable (Î» i â†¦ (v.1 i) * ((set_repr_ne f).some i) * ((set_repr_ne g).some i))


/-
  We define the multiplication between a real number and a function in H as the pointwise product. We show that the result lies in H.
-/

namespace Ring

variable {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f g : H v e Î¼)

lemma mul_repr (a : â„) : f_repr v e (Î» x â†¦ a * f.1 x) (Î» i â†¦ a * (set_repr_ne f).some i) :=

instâœ: IsFiniteMeasure Î¼
f, gâœ: â†‘(H v e Î¼)
a: â„
g:= fun x => a * â†‘f x: â†‘Î© â†’ â„

xâœ: â†‘Î©
rightâœÂ¹: Summable fun i => â†‘v i * h i ^ 2

rightâœ: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Summable fun i => â†‘v i * h i * e i x
x: â†‘Î©
comm: âˆ€ (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a * h i * e i x = a * â†‘v i * h i * e i x
summand_comm: âˆ€ (i : â„•), a * â†‘v i * h i * e i x = a * (â†‘v i * h i * e i x)
const_out: âˆ‘' (i : â„•), a * (fun i => â†‘v i * h i * e i x) i = a * âˆ‘' (i : â„•), (fun i => â†‘v i * h i * e i x) i

g_h:= fun i => a * h i: â„• â†’ â„
x: â†‘Î©
rightâœÂ¹: Summable fun i => â†‘v i * h i ^ 2
f_repr: â†‘f = fun x => âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * h i * e i x
rightâœ: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Summable fun i => â†‘v i * h i * e i x
g_eq_tsum: g = fun x => âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a * h i * e i x
g_x: g x = âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * (a * h i) * e i x
âˆ€ (i : â„•), a * h i = g_h i
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] show âˆ€ i, a * h i = g_h i by intro i; rfl:1000, a * h i ==> g_h i

instance : HMul â„ (H v e Î¼) (H v e Î¼) where
  hMul := Î» a f â†¦ âŸ¨Î» x â†¦ a * f.1 x, mul_in_H f aâŸ©

instance : HSMul â„ (H v e Î¼) (H v e Î¼) where
  hSMul := Î» r f â†¦ r * f

end Ring

/-
  We define the sum between two functions in H as the pointwise sum. We show that the result lies in H. We also define the 0 function of H. We show several properties on the addition.
-/

namespace Group

variable {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f g : H v e Î¼)

lemma zero_in_H : zero âˆˆ L2 Î¼ âˆ§ âˆƒ (a : â„• â†’ â„), (f_repr v e zero a) âˆ§ Summable (Î» i â†¦ (v.1 i) * (a i)^2) := âŸ¨memâ„’p_const 0, (Î» _ â†¦ 0), zero_repr, zero_summableâŸ©

instance : Zero (H v e Î¼) where
  zero := âŸ¨zero, zero_in_HâŸ©

instance : HAdd (H v e Î¼) (H v e Î¼) (H v e Î¼) where
  hAdd := Î» f g â†¦ âŸ¨(Î» x â†¦ f.1 x + g.1 x), add_in_H f gâŸ©

instance : HSub (H v e Î¼) (H v e Î¼) (H v e Î¼) where
  hSub := Î» f g â†¦ f + (-1 : â„) * g

instance : Neg (H v e Î¼) where
  neg := Î» f â†¦ (-1 : â„) * f

end Group

/-
  We define a function : H Ã— H â†’ â„. The purpose of the following is to prove that H endowed with this function is a inner product space.
-/
noncomputable def H_inner {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f g : H v e Î¼) : â„ := âˆ‘' i, (v.1 i) * ((set_repr_ne f).some i) * ((set_repr_ne g).some i)

/-
 - We show properties on the inner product of H and the induced norm.
-/

namespace Inner

open Ring Group

variable {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {Î¼ : Measure Î©} [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (f g : H v e Î¼)

noncomputable instance : Inner â„ (H v e Î¼) where
  inner := H_inner

noncomputable instance : Norm (H v e Î¼) where
  norm := Î» f â†¦ Real.sqrt (inner f f)

noncomputable instance : Dist (H v e Î¼) where
  dist := Î» f g â†¦ norm (f - g)

const_out: âˆ‘' (i : â„•), 2 * t * (â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i) = 2 * t * âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i
tsum_to_inner: âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i = âŸªf, gâŸ«_â„
â€–fâ€– ^ 2 + 2 * t * âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i + t ^ 2 * â€–gâ€– ^ 2 = â€–fâ€– ^ 2 + 2 * t * âŸªf, gâŸ«_â„ + t ^ 2 * â€–gâ€– ^ 2

Î¼: Measure â†‘Î©
instâœ: IsFiniteMeasure Î¼
f, g: â†‘(H v e Î¼)
t: â„
inner_nn: 0 â‰¤ âŸªf + t * g, f + t * gâŸ«_â„
a_f:= â‹¯.some: â„• â†’ â„
a_g:= â‹¯.some: â„• â†’ â„
a_f_tg:= fun i => a_f i + t * a_g i: â„• â†’ â„
a_f_tg_repr: a_f_tg âˆˆ set_repr (f + t * g)
distribute: âˆ€ (i : â„•),
  â†‘v i * a_f_tg i * a_f_tg i = â†‘v i * a_f i * a_f i + 2 * t * (â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i) + t ^ 2 * (â†‘v i * a_g i * a_g i)
add_summable: Summable fun i => â†‘v i * a_f i * a_f i + 2 * t * (â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i)
tsum_to_norm: âˆ€ (h : â†‘(H v e Î¼)), âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * â‹¯.some i * â‹¯.some i = â€–hâ€– ^ 2
const_outâœ: âˆ‘' (i : â„•), t ^ 2 * (â†‘v i * a_g i * a_g i) = t ^ 2 * âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a_g i * a_g i
const_out: âˆ‘' (i : â„•), 2 * t * (â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i) = 2 * t * âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i
tsum_to_inner: âˆ‘' (i : â„•), â†‘v i * a_f i * a_g i = âŸªf, gâŸ«_â„
â€–fâ€– ^ 2 + 2 * t * âŸªf, gâŸ«_â„ + t ^ 2 * â€–gâ€– ^ 2 = â€–fâ€– ^ 2 + 2 * t * âŸªf, gâŸ«_â„ + t ^ 2 * â€–gâ€– ^ 2
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™

tâ‚€:= -âŸªf, gâŸ«_â„ / â€–gâ€– ^ 2: â„

Î¼: Measure â†‘Î©

end Inner


/-
  We show properties on the distance induced by the inner product of H.
-/

namespace Dist

open Inner Ring Group

lemma H_dist_self (a : H v e Î¼) : dist a a = 0 :=

  add := Î» f g â†¦ f + g
  add_assoc := Group.H_add_assoc
  zero_add := Group.H_zero_add
  add_zero := Group.H_add_zero

  neg := Î» f â†¦ -f
  zsmul := Î» z f â†¦ (z : â„) * f
  add_left_neg := Group.H_add_left_neg
  add_comm := Group.H_add_comm
  dist_self := Dist.H_dist_self
  dist_comm := Dist.H_dist_comm
  dist_triangle := Dist.H_dist_triangle

  eq_of_dist_eq_zero := Dist.H_eq_of_dist_eq_zero
  dist_eq := Î» x y â†¦

/- --- MERCER --- -/
/-
  Given the Mercer's theorem, we prove that H, endowed with k is a RKHS.
-/

def mercer (v : eigen) (e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„) (k : Î© â†’ Î© â†’ â„) := âˆ€ s, (k s = Î» t â†¦ âˆ‘' i, v.1 i * e i s * e i t) âˆ§ (âˆ€ t, Summable (fun i â†¦ v.1 i * e i s * e i t))

lemma k_repr {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {k : Î© â†’ Î© â†’ â„} (h_mercer : mercer v e k) : âˆ€ s, f_repr v e (k s) (Î» i â†¦ e i s) := Î» s â†¦ âŸ¨(h_mercer s).1, Î» t â†¦ (h_mercer s).2 tâŸ©

lemma k_i_H {v : eigen} {e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„} {k : Î© â†’ Î© â†’ â„} (h_mercer : mercer v e k) (hk_l2 : âˆ€ s, k s âˆˆ L2 Î¼) : âˆ€ s, k s âˆˆ H v e Î¼ :=

variable (k : Î© â†’ Î© â†’ â„) (v : eigen) (e : â„• â†’ Î© â†’ â„) (h_mercer : mercer v e k) (hk_l2 : âˆ€ s, k s âˆˆ L2 Î¼)

instance : RKHS (H v e Î¼) where
  k := k
  memb := k_i_H h_mercer hk_l2
  repro := k_repro h_mercer hk_l2
